At today’s E&C Health Subcommittee legislative hearing, I spoke in support of my bill, H.R. 167, Patient Access to Urgent-Use Pharmacy Compounding Act.

At today’s Energy subcommittee hearing, I questioned witnesses on different aspects of grid reliability, including what factors FERC takes into account when issuing new reliability standards and the availability of transformers in the U.S.

As the country introduces electric school buses to school districts, I pressed EPA IG O’Donnell on whether switching to an all electric fleet makes sense throughout the country, including large mountainous districts like the one I represent.

On a day of unimaginable evil, we saw the best of what it means to be an American, making the ultimate sacrifice so that others might live. The heroes of that day proved that America will not be broken.

#NeverForget #WeRemember

We must never forget the 3,000 innocent Americans who died at the World Trade Center, the Pentagon, and on Flight 93, their lives stolen that fateful day.

We also honor our first responders, who put themselves in harm’s way in an attempt to save their fellow Americans.
Today we remember and honor the innocent lives lost 22 years ago on September 11, 2001.
The Carnegie Medal is awarded to those who risk death or serious physical injury to an extraordinary degree while saving or attempting to save the lives of others.

I was honored to present Rayna Montgomery with the Carnegie Medal, awarded by the Carnegie Hero Fund Commission, for her heroic actions in helping to rescue a girl from drowning in Kure Beach, North Carolina, on April 18, 2021.

Congratulations to Blake Hall of Marion Senior High School, and the rest of Team USA, for winning the 2023 World Youth Fly Fishing Championship. Blake was one of the youngest to compete in the championship at just 14 years old - so impressive!

Congressman Griffith’s Weekly E-Newsletter 9.1.23

Topic: Labor Day

morgangriffith.house.gov/new…

I applaud Press Glass’ decision to expand their U.S. manufacturing presence in Henry County, bringing 335 new jobs to the region. This investment is great news for our economy, and I look forward to the facility’s completion in the near future.
I was excited to attend today’s historic announcement at Commonwealth Crossing Business Centre. Southside Virginia has the people, resources, and infrastructure for manufacturers to thrive.

In Fieldale this morning, I joined the Dan River Basin Association and Virginia Museum of Natural History for a release of Brook trout into the Smith River with homeschooled students from Henry County and the City of Martinsville.

I was recently in Norton with @Virginia_Energy presenting a $2.5 million check to the Lonesome Pine Regional Industrial Facilities Authority for their Project Thoroughbred. The funds were made possible by the Abandoned Mine Land Economic Revitalization (AMLER) grant program.

Once complete, the site should attract large scale economic development projects, positively impacting Wise County for years to come.

The redevelopment of abandoned mine land has the potential to bring new businesses and jobs to Southwest Virginia. This $1.7 million grant will do just that, helping to build infrastructure on the Elam Farm Industrial Site, ensuring it is pad ready.

It was great to be in Wise where I joined @Virginia_Energy in presenting a check to the @WiseEconIndDev for the Elam Farm Industrial Site development. The funds were made possible by the Abandoned Mine Land Economic Revitalization (AMLER) grant program.
Yesterday in Haysi, I had the honor of presenting Korean War veteran, William Fink, with replacement medals that my office was able to obtain.
I enjoyed attending and speaking at the Virginia Credit Union League’s legislative reception in Roanoke last night.
On Saturday, I attended the grand re-opening of Primped 365 in Christiansburg, which provides custom wigs and paramedical tattooing to survivors of breast cancer. Congratulations, Jeneen!
Yesterday, I was honored to attend and speak at the groundbreaking of the Calfee Community & Cultural Center in Pulaski.
It was good to meet and talk with Benjamin Agee, a Boy Scout who is working towards his Citizenship in the Community Merit Badge.
I, and the other co-chairs of the Congressional Coal Caucus, recently participated in a roundtable discussion with executive members of America’s Coal Associations while in White Sulphur Springs, WV.

After presiding over the House today, I had difficulty getting through the press gaggle. 

Had fun setting the record straight.

This morning at Feeding Southwest Virginia’s Elected Officials Day, I joined Congressman Ben Cline, state and local elected officials, and community partners to discuss food insecurity in our region.

Today, on National Purple Heart Day, we honor the service and sacrifice of those in our armed forces who have been wounded or killed in action. We owe these brave men and women an enduring debt of gratitude.
Yesterday, I was honored to attend and speak at the Riverhill Baptist Church’s 150th Church Anniversary Celebration in Grayson County.
Happy to have visited the Buchanan County Public Library in Grundy today to read to children in the Summer Reading Program and also answer questions from constituents.

This morning I visited the Appalachian College of Pharmacy to discuss my work on the Energy & Commerce Subcommittee on Health with President Mickey McGlothlin, Dean Susan Mayhew, and others. While there, I had an opportunity to speak to a second-year class of future pharmacists!

Topic: Office of Refugee Resettlement

morgangriffith.house.gov/new…
Continuing my questions about the sweetheart separation deal of former Acting Chief of Police Pittman. ⬇️

At today's hearing, I questioned Secretary Becerra about a number of ORR practices, including ways ORR establishes familial relationships between minors and sponsors and if they work with local child welfare agencies.

The Office of Refugee Resettlement has faced an unprecedented surge in the number of unaccompanied minors referred to its custody. Today we will review how HHS and ORR have responded to this surge, especially in light of recent reports of exploitation and neglect of these minors.

At today’s Energy Subcommittee hearing on expanding American nuclear energy, I asked witnesses from the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission about the necessity of mandatory hearings for nuclear licenses.

The bill passed the subcommittee by voice vote and will now be considered by the full committee.

During today’s Health Subcommittee markup, I spoke in favor of my bill, H.R. 3285, the Fairness for Patient Medications Act. This bill is designed to ensure that insurance companies and PBMs cannot charge patients more than the price they negotiate themselves for certain drugs.

Defending our nation’s critical infrastructure – like our hospitals, schools, pipelines, and wastewater plants – from cyberattacks continues to only get more difficult. Every day, malicious actors demonstrate an increasing willingness & growing capacity to execute these attacks.
Today I questioned U.S. Capitol Police Chief Manger on inconsistent policies and procedures for Department leadership versus rank and file.
At today’s House Admin Hearing, I questioned U.S. Capitol Police Chief J. Thomas Manger about actions taken by Capitol Police leadership and their Office of General Counsel in regards to January 6th.
It was a pleasure to meet with Bland County Commonwealth Attorney, Patrick White, in D.C. today!

During a health subcommittee hearing, I discussed the importance of ensuring compliance of entities performing U.S.-funded research & how to promote domestic manufacturing of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients as to not be reliant on foreign nations for our most needed medicines.

Drug shortages in our country can cost lives.

Our country is currently experiencing the very serious problem of prescription drug shortages, many of which are in the generic drug space. We must use an all of the above approach to solve this life threatening issue as Americans deserve reliable access to needed medications.

We should utilize our full range of options to give underserved areas in our country the internet access they need.
How is it that the federal government is spending billions of dollars to deploy broadband across our country and yet many Americans, including folks in my district, are still without internet access?

Enjoyed giving an update on my work in D.C. at the Bedford Area Chamber of Commerce Legislative Breakfast this morning!

According to the CDC, at least 2.8 million people in the U.S. are infected w/ antibiotic-resistant bacteria per year, burdening our nation’s health care system. We must explore possible solutions to this public health crisis, like phage therapy, & what the federal govt’s role is.

Check out my questioning from today's hearing on improving our country's biosafety guidelines when conducting risky research. ⬇️

Our existing oversight framework for risky research isn’t working given the probability that COVID-19 was the result of a laboratory incident at the Wuhan Institute of Virology, which received NIH funding. It is clear that we must update our biosafety guidelines.

We must clear the red tape at the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) to allow for greater patient access to health insurance and critical treatments, like those treating Alzheimer's Disease.

morgangriffith.house.gov/new…
It was a pleasure to talk with students from Liberty University and Hampton University about Congress and the current political climate during their visit to Washington.

ICYMI: I questioned witnesses that I invited before my Subcommittee on the ways data brokers collect and sell Americans’ data and how we can craft legislation to protect people’s privacy while still allowing informed information sharing.
Data brokers are collecting, packaging, and selling data on almost all Americans, frequently without their knowledge or consent. We must explore possible safeguards against these predatory practices.

At today’s Health Subcommittee hearing I voiced my concerns with the exploitation of the 340B program by some hospitals & how Pharmacy Benefit Managers have taken predatory actions against Community Health Centers, both of which negatively effect my district & need remedying.

Virginia has the potential to play an outsized role in the expansion of small modular nuclear reactor development in the U.S. but in order to do so, we must focus on strengthening the skills of our workforce to be able to build and maintain these advanced nuclear sites.
The American people deserve answers as to how this happened and why the NIH continues to fund EcoHealth Alliance after its grant violations.
The NIH and their grantee EcoHealth Alliance have yet to answer for their failure to effectively monitor and document the activities of subgrantee Wuhan Institute of Virology on coronavirus research.
This is completely unacceptable and ORR’s practices need to change immediately.

HHS’ Office of Refugee Resettlement has prioritized fast tracking the release of unaccompanied children to sponsors instead of thoroughly vetting sponsors, resulting in an increased risk of these children being trafficked and exploited.
Today’s hearing gives Congress needed insight into the Inspector General office’s work to provide crucial oversight over the agency.

I’ve been alarmed by HHS’ lack of competency in multiple areas, especially their complete inability to manage unaccompanied minors in the care of the Office of Refugee Resettlement & the NIH’s failure to conduct routine oversight of its grantees, specifically EcoHealth Alliance.

Congressman Griffith’s Weekly E-Newsletter 2.17.23

Topic: Biden’s Border Crisis is also a Public Health Crisis
morgangriffith.house.gov/new…

Mexican cartels are smuggling fentanyl into our country at record rates, through ports of entry and on the backs of illegal immigrants. We must take action now to close our borders to curb the influx of this deadly substance.

The Biden Admin’s disastrous border policies have led to a public health crisis. In 2022, the DEA seized over 379 million doses of fentanyl, enough to kill every American. @HouseCommerce will continue to shed light on this national emergency, even if the White House ignores it.
After, I had a chance to meet with the owners of McCraw’s Virginia 500 grocery store.

I had a chance to visit some great small businesses in Cana to discuss challenges and policies affecting small businesses!

First, I stopped by to meet with the owners of Hill’s Shoes, a family owned shoe store that has been in business since 1927.
Thanks to Dr. Carole Everhart, DNP, FNP-BC for meeting with me yesterday and giving us a tour of Everhart Primary Health Care in Cana, VA.
On November 27, 2021, Alpha Company left Bedford on a one year out of country deployment as part of "Operation Red Dragon" in support of the Combined Joint Task Force to the Horn of Africa.
I was honored to attend the Welcome Home Parade for Alpha Company, 1st Battalion, 116th Infantry Brigade Combat Team of the 29th Infantry Division in Bedford, VA this weekend.

Topic: WOTUS is Baaackk!!!

In addition to Nanci, we were also able to meet with other Aeroprobe leadership. Aeroprobe, a producer of air data and flow measurement systems, delivers systems to multiple industries throughout the world, including the aerospace, automotive, and wind turbine industries.

Thank you to Nanci Hardwick, CEO of MELD Manufacturing and Aeroprobe in Christiansburg, for giving us a tour of the MELD Manufacturing facility. It was great to learn more about the work they are doing in the metal additive market.

In Wise to announce $371,000 Abandoned Mine Land Economic Revitalization (AMLER) grant for updates to the Wise Sports Complex, including new lighting for fields. I worked here in Congress to expand the AMLER program into Virginia.

In Dickenson County to announce a $869,584 Abandoned Mine Land Economic Revitalization (AMLER) grant for site preparation work at Red Onion Industrial Site, which will attract new business to the county. I worked here in Congress to expand the AMLER program into Virginia.

My team was in Trammel to announce a $150,000 Abandoned Mine Land Economic Revitalization (AMLER) grant for community improvements, including needed building removal. I worked here in Congress to expand the AMLER program into Virginia.

Great meeting with local business and community leaders of Smith Mountain Lake at Mariners Landing in Huddleston. Among other things, we discussed how important the lake is to the region and ways to ensure it continue to be an economic driver for the area.

Was also great to have a chance to make a couple of stops in Bedford yesterday, thanks to the Sheriff, and talk with folks about different agricultural and economic development issues affecting the county.
A big thanks to Bedford County Sheriff Mike Miller for giving us a tour of the Sheriff’s office and dispatch center yesterday.

Today we honor the life and legacy of Martin Luther King Jr.  

King dedicated his life to fighting for racial equality and civil liberties for all in the United States, believing that in a world full of unknowns, you must never give up and always have hope.
